channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 26th February
item.description:
Customer reports that the temporary TS at the location are out and that they have been stuck in traffic for around an hour. They state that nobody was on site when they passed through and that this stretches back to the A417.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.description:
Both traffic lights on constant red No workers on site Traffic build up enormous all the way to shell garage In brockworth and up a417 I don’t know the impact into Cheltenham

item.title: Temporary traffic lights stick on ref, 26th February
item.description:
Traffic lights stuck on red causing traffic to run the Red light heading to Cheltenham once on coming traffic heading out of Cheltenham stops. This is causing massive tailbacks and delays.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Temporary traffic lights stuck on red, 26th February
item.description:
Traffic lights are stuck on red for traffic travelling to Cheltenham. Traffic is having to go when on coming traffic stops for a red on their side heading out of Cheltenham. It is causing seriously long delays.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hugs potholes, 26th February
item.description:
Not just one- the whole street on one side is covered in deep and wide potholes causing people to swerve onto the over side of the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham

item.title: Entire road is riddled with pot hole, 26th February
item.description:
From Gloucester road to the National hunt pub. The whole road needs resurfacing. Repairs have been done in the past and they have lasted 24 hours. This is a high traffic road due to connections to the M5. It is quickly becoming dangerous as cars swerve to avoid multiple holes, some being 100mm deep. This has been ongoing for approx 2 months. Do it properly, do it once, saves cost in the long run. Small repairs are not adequate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Squirrels causing damage to roof tiles, 25th February
item.description:
The oak tree on the public pathway outside my mother's house at 29 Howell Road GL51 0EE has numerous branches overhanging into her front garden and now within feet of my mother's property. My mother has just paid £1700 to a roofer to repair a large hole in her roof where roof tiles have been dislodged and the felt has been chewed through. The roofer stated it was damage caused by squirrels inhabiting the tree and using the branches to jump onto the roof of the house. There was evidence squirrels had been nestling in the loft insulation and the roofer advised that although they have repaired the damage she needed to report the tree to get the branches cut back to reduce the risk of it happening again. There is also the cost of my mother already paying a Gardner to pick all the debris from broken branches, acorns, leaves and make good damage caused by the squirrels. I'm also concerned with the size of some branches, one could break and cause my mother serious harm if it fell on her when she's in her front garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Howell Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
